title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 29 March 2017 - XWiki
content:
<edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
03:38 <edvorg> has quit  
03:39 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
04:34 <lukevers> has quit  
04:36 <lukevers> has joined #xwiki  
05:24 <edvorg> has quit  
07:01 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
07:39 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:42 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
08:14 <evalica> has quit  
08:34 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:01 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:36 <vmassol> good morning  
09:36 <vmassol> releasing the blog app with a dep on XWiki 9.2 for the notif module  
09:55 <vmassol> new blog id ^^^^  
09:55 <vmassol> blog app v9.3 released!  
09:56 <vmassol> (from contrib)  
09:56 <tmortagne> vmassol: the source is wrong  
09:56 <vmassol> grrr  
09:56 <vmassol> the automatic computation seems wrong then  
09:57 <vmassol> because I don't think it's defined in the pom  
09:57 <vmassol> checking  
09:57 <tmortagne> the Maven automatic computation does not know github, it just concatenate  
09:57 <tmortagne> so you need to give maste URL and not just the home of the project  
09:57 <tmortagne> so you need to give master branch URL and not just the home of the project  
09:57 <vmassol> or do what I did for the xwiki org extensions  
09:58 <vmassol> in the contrib pom  
09:58 <vmassol> contrib parent pom  
09:58 <vmassol> pointing to a url on exo with an auto redirect  
09:59 <tmortagne> I don't see anything like this in contrib parent pom  
09:59 <vmassol> what doesn maven do?  
09:59 <vmassol> what does it concatenate?  
09:59 <tmortagne> again it just concatenate  
09:59 <vmassol> was thinking about a mechanism similar to  
09:59 <vmassol> <url>http://extensions.xwiki.org?id=${project.groupId}:${project.artifactId}:${project.version}:::</url>  
10:00 <tmortagne> it expect the folder to have the name of the module  
10:00 <vmassol> if it takes the base URL from SCM then it won't work  
10:00 <vmassol> unless  
10:00 <tmortagne> see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-commons/blob/master/pom.xml#L180  
10:00 <tmortagne> we do that is most extension with several module  
10:00 <tmortagne> just do the same  
10:00 <vmassol> we agree to change the <scm><url> part  
10:00 <vmassol> (if that's what maven takes)  
10:01 <vmassol> I think this url is not used for anything except reporeting  
10:01 <vmassol> reporting  
10:01 <vmassol> so that could work maybe  
10:01 <tmortagne> reposrting what ?  
10:01 <vmassol> reports  
10:02 <vmassol> yes that should work fine  
10:02 <vmassol> testing  
10:28 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <floflobel> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <vmassol> (in meeting)  
11:04 <vmassol> back  
11:04 <vmassol> should work  
11:04 <vmassol> in  a submodule it generates  
11:04 <vmassol> <url>http://extensions.xwiki.org?id=org.xwiki.contrib.blog:application-blog-ui:9.4-SNAPSHOT:::/application-blog-ui</url>  
11:04 <vmassol> I had the following in the root pom:  
11:04 <vmassol> <url>http://extensions.xwiki.org?id=${project.groupId}:${project.artifactId}:${project.version}:::</url>  
11:05 <vmassol> so we could make a page on xwiki.org somewher to do the source redirect  
11:05 <vmassol> wdyt tmortagne ? worh it?  
11:05 <vmassol> wdyt tmortagne ? worth it?  
11:06 <vmassol> another option is to define a <property> in Maven  
11:06 <vmassol> {extensionrepository}.  
11:06 <vmassol> and have the <scm> part in the parent pom in a generic way, using this property  
11:06 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's really much simpler to just use master branch URL  
11:07 <vmassol> sure except nobody does and we have plenty of broken sources everywhere  
11:07 <tmortagne> not really, many extension have the right URL  
11:07 <tmortagne> not really, many extensions have the right URL  
11:08 <vmassol> so you think there's nothing to improve  
11:08 <vmassol> fine  
11:08 <vmassol> do you agree with the <scm> approach above though?  
11:08 <vmassol> (it's simple)  
11:09 <tmortagne> I don't understand your example  
11:09 <vmassol> hold on  
11:09 <tmortagne> the URL you used is the URL that lead to the extension page  
11:09 <tmortagne> not github  
11:10 <tmortagne> it's not so easy to find the github URL from the extension id  
11:10 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/38684a939bcf5484a718cc76872b6cfb  
11:11 <vmassol> (I've updated it)  
11:11 <vmassol> actually xwiki.scm could be replaced by xwiki.repo.name  
11:11 <vmassol> or xwiki.scm.name  
11:12 <tmortagne> sure you can provide property for scm if you want  
11:12 <vmassol> xwiki.github.repoName  
11:12 <tmortagne> yes the property should contain github in its name IMO  
11:12 <vmassol> xwiki.repoName  
11:12 <tmortagne> since it's specific to github  
11:12 <vmassol> unless we want to be independent of github  
11:12 <vmassol> it would also work with a differnet scm type  
11:12 <tmortagne> it's the github id so it cannot really be independent from it  
11:13 <vmassol> it's the top location of the sources  
11:13 <vmassol> would work with cvs, subversion, etc  
11:13 <vmassol> but fine it's a detail  
11:14 <tmortagne> hmm  
11:14 <vmassol> we're quite linked to github anyway  
11:14 <tmortagne> not so sure the release plugin will like to have the <scm> in the parent pom  
11:14 <tmortagne> since it modify it  
11:14 <vmassol> indeed  
11:14 <vmassol> good point  
11:14 <vmassol> would prbably not work  
11:14 <vmassol> need to be checked  
11:14 <tmortagne> I think that's why I did not do it like I did for jira last time  
11:15 <tmortagne> but I don't think I tested  
11:26 <sgc072> has joined #xwiki  
11:51 <martinus\_\_> vmassol, we've moved our xwiki install from tomcat to jetty, I've copied over the pernament dir too but now the DW shows up after login  ?  
11:53 <martinus\_\_> hi  tmortagne do you have an idea ?  
11:54 <tmortagne> martinus\_\_: appart from the permanent dir not being where you think it should be no  
11:54 <martinus\_\_> tmortagne, agree  
11:55 <tmortagne> by "jetty" you mean you setup jetty yourself or you use the jett/hsqldb XWiki package ?  
11:55 <martinus\_\_> jetty by itself  
11:55 <martinus\_\_> standlaone  
11:56 <martinus\_\_> I think I understand  
11:56 <tmortagne> then you should double check the permanent dir setup in xwiki.properties I guess  
12:01 <martinus\_\_> thanks tmortagne , " I've copied over the pernament dir too" => I was wrong.  
12:02 <tmortagne> ok  
12:02 <martinus\_\_> just created an empty dir instead.....  
12:12 <martinus\_\_> we'll see if it fixes that session stealing issue ...  
12:24 <vmassol> seems we have a blocker: https://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-14134 (not very important but still bloker since it's likely a regression)  
12:24 <vmassol> I'm already on another blocker so if someone could have a look that would be rgeat  
13:00 <sgc072> Hi vmassol , Can Angularjs be used while developing the glossary application? I think it is easy to use and more advanced than plain javascript.  
13:05 <simfir> has quit  
13:05 <simfir> has joined #xwiki  
14:02 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:39 <vmassol> sgc072: we use jquery in XWiki so it would be nicer to use that if you need to write javascript  
14:40 <vmassol> angularjs is also nice when you have full UIs  
14:40 <vmassol> but here it won't be the case  
14:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: I'm planning to implement the ESCAPE thing using a Query Filter. I'm adding the capability to "filter" query parameters to QueryFilter. We can then decide later if we want to have this filter on by default or not. Sounds good to you?  
14:43 <tmortagne> sure, QueryFilter should probably be given a chance to filter the whole Query  
14:45 <vmassol> indeed, I'm adding default Map<String, Object> filterNamedParameters(Map<String, Object> namedParameters)  and Map<Integer, Object> filterPositionalParameters(Map<Integer, Object> positionalParameters) but I guess I could introduce instead a more generic: default Query filter(Query query)... And in this case we could deprecate filterStatement() too  
14:45 <tmortagne> need a big more that that since there is no setStatement in Query  
14:45 <tmortagne> need a bit more that that since there is no setStatement in Query  
14:46 <vmassol> that's ok  
14:46 <vmassol> you could construct a new DefaultQuery() or some other class  
14:46 <vmassol> or some WrappingQuery  
14:46 <vmassol> that we would introdsuce  
14:46 <vmassol> that we would introduce  
14:46 <vmassol> so that only the part that you wish can be overridden  
14:53 <vmassol> new WrappingQuery(...)  
14:53 <vmassol> wrappingQuery.setStatement(...)  
14:53 <tmortagne> sure  
14:53 <vmassol> WrappingQuery would act as a helper  
15:03 <msmeria> has quit  
15:21 <acotiuga> has quit  
15:21 <acotiuga1> has joined #xwiki  
15:25 <SotoX3[m]> has joined #xwiki  
15:45 <SotoX3[m]> Hello, Is there a way to make the navigation panel visible to an unregistered user?  
15:45 <vmassol> SotoX3: that's the default  
15:45 <vmassol> the nav panel shows the doc that the user has permissions to see  
15:46 <vmassol> s/doc/docs  
15:48 <SotoX3[m]> Okay, so maybe I just haven't defined which docs unregistered users can see yet?  
15:48 <vmassol> yes probably  
15:50 <SotoX3[m]> Great, I checked in the rights section and made the fix. I can see the nav panel when testing. Thank you!  
16:07 <acotiuga1> has left #xwiki

16:15 <sgc072> Please guide how to proceed for solving this bug : http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-4580

16:28 <mflorea> has quit  
17:07 <vmassol> sgc072: I cannot help you much as I don't know the topic. You need to understand XWiki first and then ask specific questions. Otherwise it'll just mean that I would fix the issue but not you :)  
17:18 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:19 <sgc072> has quit  
17:58 <vmassol> btw guys just used the following new features from mockito, quite nice as a shorthand notation:  
17:58 <vmassol>         when(filter.filterQuery(any(Query.class))).then(returnsFirstArg());  
17:59 <tmortagne> indeed returnsFirstArg is nice
